At his plea hearing in January 2008, Strom pleaded guilty to one count of possession of child pornography in exchange for other charges being dropped. He was sentenced to 23 months in prison in April 2008. Following his arrest and conviction, the National Vanguard was disbanded. Strom had a documented long-time fascination with young girls and exploited his position within the extremist movement.

name: Daniel Dean Thompson
description: Daniel Dean Thompson, age 31, was arrested in 2008 on charges of unlawful sexual activity with minors and patronizing a minor prostitute. Thompson allegedly operated a film editing business that he claimed sanitized movies to remove objectionable content for family viewing, but the business served as a front for child sexual exploitation. According to police reports, Thompson and co-owner Isaac Lifferth allegedly paid two 14-year-old girls $20 each to perform oral sex. Police found a large quantity of pornographic movies inside the business along with a keg of beer, painkillers, and two cameras hooked up to a television. Thompson told the teen victims his film business was a cover for a pornography studio. He was charged with two counts of unlawful sexual activity with a minor and two counts of patronizing a prostitute. Note: Clean Flicks company later sued Thompson, claiming he falsely connected himself to their company and was never affiliated with it.

name: Lawrence Scott Ward
description: Lawrence Scott Ward was a 63-year-old professor at the Wharton School of Business at the University of Pennsylvania, known for expertise on media effects on children. In August 2006, authorities discovered child pornography in his luggage and laptop computer when he arrived at Dulles International Airport near Washington, D.C., on a flight from Brazil. A search of his office at Wharton's Huntsman Hall uncovered over 80 images of Ward and a young boy (no older than 15) in intimate situations, with the boy featured in a series of pornographic DVDs found in Ward's mail. Ward pleaded guilty on May 17, 2007 to producing child pornography for importation into the United States, receiving 15 years in prison and a $17,500 fine. On November 17, 2008, he pleaded guilty to all four Pennsylvania child pornography and sexual misconduct charges and received an additional 25-year sentence.

name: James E. West
description: James E. West (Jim West) was a Republican politician from Spokane, Washington who served in the state legislature starting in 1982 and became mayor of Spokane in 2003. In May 2005, a local newspaper investigation published allegations that West had sexually molested young boys more than 20 years earlier, in the late 1970s or early 1980s. West was accused of abusing at least two young men during his time as a sheriff's deputy and while volunteering with the Boy Scouts as a troop leader. Although never formally charged, voters overwhelmingly recalled West from office in a special election on December 6, 2005, with 65% voting to oust him. His term ended on December 16, 2005. The FBI investigated the allegations but closed the case without taking action due to lack of sufficient evidence.

name: Steve Wilsey
description: Steve Wilsey was a youth counselor and activist affiliated with Focus on the Family, an evangelical Christian organization, and was reportedly a protg of James Dobson, the founder of Focus on the Family. Wilsey was charged with and convicted of sexual assault after molesting an 8-year-old boy. His case represented a significant scandal for Focus on the Family and exposed the organization's vulnerability regarding child safety within its youth counseling programs.

name: Paul Williams
description: Paul Williams was a minister of prayer and special projects at Bellevue Baptist Church, a major Southern Baptist megachurch. In 2006, an internal church investigation revealed that Williams had sexually abused his son over a period of 12-18 months, beginning in 1990 when his son was an adolescent. Williams admitted to and was convicted of the sexual abuse. According to the investigation, church leaders including the current pastor, Reverend Steve Gaines, learned about the abuse but did not immediately report it to authorities. The abuse only came to light in December 2005 after Williams' son prodded Pastor Gaines to explain why his father was still allowed to serve as a minister. Williams was subsequently fired from his position at the church.

name: Glenn Murphy Jr.
description: Glenn Murphy Jr. was a prominent Republican politician who served as president of the Young Republican National Federation. In August 2007, he resigned from his position after being accused of sexually assaulting another man. The assault allegedly occurred on July 29, 2007, when Murphy, age 33, performed oral sex on a 22-year-old man without consent while the victim slept. The assault happened following a Young Republicans gathering and after a night of drinking at the victim's sister's house. Murphy pleaded not guilty to the charges but was convicted of class B felony sexual assault. He was sentenced to six years in prison and is now a registered sex offender. Additionally, another man had accused Murphy of sexual assault in 1998, though no charges were filed at that time.
